README: This JSON document represents the test configuration options.
source_description: Connection parameters to your MySQL database
Please ensure, that you have defined all parameters properly.
Ensure, that details like 'charset' are included (if necessary).
Notice, any parameter, acceptable by the node mysql2 module can be placed here.
target_description: Connection parameters to your PostgreSQL database
Please ensure, that you have defined all parameters properly.
Ensure, that details like 'charset' are included (if necessary). nmig_test_db
Notice, any parameter, acceptable by the node pg module can be placed here.
schema_description: A name of the schema, that will contain all migrated tables.
If not supplied, then a new schema will be created automatically.
remove_test_resources_description: If true, then all resources created by test scripts will be removed.
number_of_records_description: nmig can generate simple test database (MySQL) to measure performance.
For that matter, run '$ npm run generate' command.
The DB will contain only one table - 'table_a', found in test-schema.sql
The goal is to create one, possibly large table, with tens of columns of various types, to be able to measure nmig performance.
Note, prior running nmig to migrate database, you should set 'number_of_simultaneously_running_loader_processes' to appropriate number,
hence, allow nmig to migrate multiple tables in parallel.
For example, migration of one large table will take nmig roughly the same time as migration of two or even more large tables, depends on various factors.
Param below is a number of records to generate in that DB, in the 'table_a' table.
